intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. symphytoides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, hairy leaves that are alternate and lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is also noted for its role in ecological systems as a food source for various insects and as a colonizer of degraded areas.
